chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfred A Rivas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Programs eligible only after the first 2 years of Incarceration are served.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.
Attend school/obtain HSED.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional.
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
No criminal conduct.
Not associate with those who possess illegal controlled substances.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Provide DNA sample.
Provide any random drug testing deemed appropriate by the agent.
